org.fhnw.aigs.swingClient.GUI

Class BaseBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.fhnw.aigs.swingClient.GUI.BaseBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public abstract class BaseBoard
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The abstract BaseBoard class offers a convenient base class for classic board games like chess. It is limited to two dimensions: X and Y.
    The fields of the board are defined as Panes which act as a very flexible container for all kinds of fields. Due to the nature of the parent class, GridPane it is possible to add new content inside the grid by using the "add" method in the following way:
    board.add(field, xPosition, yPosition).
    Please note: It is not possible to use BaseBoard directly as it is an abstract class.
    Version:
    v1.0
    Author:
    Matthias St√∂ckli
    See Also:

      • setFields

        public abstract void setFields()
        Used to define the fields of the board. Usually the appearance of the fields will also be defined by this method. A structure like this should work well:

        // Iterate through all fields on the x and y axis, add the field to the for(int i = 0; i < fieldsX; i++){ for(int j = 0; j < fieldsY; j++){ // Instantiate a new field, add it to the fieldPanes and add the field // as a graphical node. YourField yourField = new TicTacToeField(); yourBoard[i][j] = yourBoard; this.add(yourField, i, j); } } Where YourField is a custom field class, usually a Pane or similar and yourBoard is the board instance.

      • setEventHandlers

        public abstract void setEventHandlers()
        In this method the event handlers will be set, i.e. what every part of the GUI actually does.

      • manipulateGUI

        public abstract void manipulateGUI(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message message)
        This message should contain all GUI related tasks based on the messages received. Usually this method should be called by the Game.processGameLogic(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message, org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Player) method.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be processed. If there is no message, just pass null.
